intro: Gaudichaudia enrico-martinezii, commonly known as the Enrico-Martinez's gaudichaudia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a distinctive yellow center. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
